content.description:
Getting to the crack is crux

This is a sollid V3 for taller people and a V4 for shorter. Shorter climbers have some cruxy starting moves before the crack.

A SDS would increase difficulty as well.
content.location: Up the hill from parking lot

content.description:
This route has not been sent yet. This is just put up for info. This will definitely go.

The crux is getting to a crack on the ledge, about 3 1/2 ft to the right from the main 3 inch crack that will be used to top out.

These moves are very very fun. Takes some precision and strength. All the moves are possible, just needs to be pieced together.
content.location: Begin on the right arete. There are a variety of holds here, from from cracks, pinches, crimps, and underclings. Situate your self for a hard throw (height dependent) to the hidden crack on the top ledge (the visor), work your way to the crack to maneuver an amazing mantle.

content.description: This route tops out left of dragon egg. Starts similar, on the left, but follow the arete to top out. Don't topout via the crack.
content.location: Begin on the left side arete with a side pull and broken bit on the bottom of the the Dragon. A SDS variation can be done at greater difficulty.
